texts: Three illegal minicab operators and controllers face fines and costs totaling more than £1,500 following spot checks and investigations by TfL's Public Carriage Office (PCO) as part of a drive to make minicabs safer.

At Brent Magistrates Court on Thursday 11th March, the PCO prosecuted three individuals who had been reported by PCO Licensing Officers for the offence of operating without a Private Hire Operators Licence for London. The operators were based in Hackney, Wood Green and Feltham.
Details of the prosecutions are attached.
Public Carriage Office Director Ed Thompson said:

"The message to illegal operators is loud and clear - we will track you down. We are well on the way to licensing the minicab industry that will raise standards to bring safer and more reliable travel to London."
The offence of trading without a licence in London currently carries a maximum fine of £2500.

Since 2001 minicab operators must hold a licence from the PCO to run a service. Since 1st June 2003 it is an offence to drive a minicab without a private hire driving licence or a temporary permit issued by the PCO. Licensing of vehicles will start in April 2004.

There were 3 prosecution cases heard at Brent Magistrates Court on Thursday 11th March 2004.
All of the cases relate to individuals that have been reported for the offence of trading without a licence.
The results of these cases are as follows: -

Name: Fatai Oluwole OGUNRIBIDO
Business Name: Eclipse Exclusive Cars
Business Address: 725 - 755 Lordship Lane, Wood Green, London N22
Position: Operator
Result Pleaded guilty. £200 fine plus £307 costs
